definition[0]: a system of accounts in which the profit or loss for a particular period of time is based on the amounts of money received and paid out during that period, rather than on goods or services provided during that period
example[0]: Some firms are allowed to pay VAT on a cash basis: VAT need only be paid when the invoice bearing VAT has actually been paid.
definition[1]: if you receive goods or services on a cash basis, you must pay for them as soon as you receive them rather than paying later
example[1]: If hotel guests have no credit cards they are asked to prepay for their stay on a cash basis.
